revised_title: Effects of Anti-ACh-Receptor Antibodies on Neuromuscular Transmission
tldr: The authors studied the effects of injecting rabbits and rats with purified acetylcholine receptors from Torpedo electric organ. This led to diminished acetylcholine sensitivity, reduced miniature end-plate potentials, and blockage of neuromuscular transmission. The results suggest that anti-ACh-receptor antibodies may be involved in neuromuscular diseases like myasthenia gravis.
